title: Critical points of an exponential function

content.question: Let g be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mi>k</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4048@</annotation> </semantics> </math> where k is a constant. For what value of k does g have a critical point at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>2</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> <mo>?</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AA1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 5.2: Extreme Value Theorem, Global Versus Local Extrema, and Critical Points

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
